@TonyJuniper Good to see this visit but surely the local water company @AffinityWater, farmers and @EnvAgency have been aware of the destruction going on here for years?
Disgraceful! As usual the quango that is @EnvAgency does nothing. If you are not part of the solution you are part of the problem. https://t.co/nTdX6wAkmJ

No news is good news! Whilst the river gauge over the past week looks like a rollercoaster thankfully the rain has held off enough to avoid barriers being deployed so far. With all our COVID work currently it's quite a relief! @BoATownCouncil @DWFRSBoA @EnvAgencySW @WiltsPrepared https://t.co/m0OWnbwT7v

text: I can only assume from this that @EnvAgency do no due diligence on these exports. https://t.co/tkbdUIuDCp

Bulgaria is accused of burning waste illegally in coal fired power stations. Bulgaria has no EfW facilities never mind R1 rated facilities. I asked via FOI where this waste went. I received this. @EnvAgency you will not stop the illegal export of waste by helping to cover it up. https://t.co/fDvMhlhHsj https://t.co/RswygwDEqh
RT @EnvAgencySW: Heavy rain across the South West is expected to impact some roads. Take care and never drive through flood water. https://…

@TheProspect1 @EnvAgencySW @ExeterCouncil The sooner we get beavers back on the Exe and its tributaries the better. Then not so reliant on these brute force defences downstream, hopefully they will be there for the increasingly likely big rainful event that will overtop. Why not already!?
